verses.roman:
mūrkha, nīca, kṣudra muñi viṣaya-lālasa
vaiṣṇavājñā-bale kari eteka sāhasa

synonyms: mūrkha—foolish; nīca—lowborn; kṣudra—very insignificant; muñi—I; viṣaya—material; lālasa—desires; vaiṣṇava—of the Vaiṣṇavas; ājñā—order; bale—on the strength of; kari—I do; eteka—so much; sāhasa—energy.
translation: I am foolish, lowborn and insignificant, and I always desire material enjoyment; yet by the order of the Vaiṣṇavas I am greatly enthusiastic to write this transcendental literature.
